column1:
API Knowledge:
java.lang.Integer class can be converted to the following data types:
1) int; 2) long; 3)float; 4) double; 5) String
java.lang.String class can be converted to the following data types:
1) int; 2) double; 3) boolean; 4) integer 5) character; 6) long; 7) float
Q: Based on the knowledge above, can the data types of java.lang.Integer and java.lang.String be converted to each other?,A: Yes

API Knowledge:
java.util.Scanner class can be converted to the following data types:
1) int; 2) String; 3) long; 4) float; 5) double
java.lang.System.out.print method can be converted to the following data types:
1) int; 2) float; 3) double; 4) char; 5) boolean
Q: Based on the knowledge above, can the data types of java.util.Scanner and java.lang.System.out.print be converted to each other?,A: No

API Knowledge:
java.util.Arrays class can be converted to the following data types:
1) int; 2) double; 3) char; 4) boolean; 5) string; 6) List; 7) Stream
java.util.List class can be converted to the following data types:
1) ArrayList; 2) LinkedList; 3) Vector; 4) Stack; 5) AbstractList
Q: Based on the above knowledge, can the data types of java.util.Arrays and java.util.List be converted to each other?,A: Yes

API Knowledge:
java.io.BufferedReader class can be converted to the following data types:
1) String; 2) Integer; 3) Boolean; 4) Date/Time
java.io.BufferedWriter class can be converted to the following data types:
1) File Writer; 2) String Writer 3) Print Writer 4) OutputStream Writer
Q: Based on the knowledge above, can the data types of java.io.BufferedReader and java.io.BufferedWriter be converted to each other?,A: No
